00026 #define XOR(a,b) ((bool(a) && (! bool(b))) || (bool(b) && (! bool(a))))
00027 
00028 /*
00029  *  Feature! 
00030  *  Use exit count (1-4)in roundabout exit/entry connection so
00031  *  ExpandRouteProcessor can detect symmetries.
00032  *  This will enable the use of LEFT_ROUNDABOUT, RIGHT_ROUNDABOUT and AHEAD
00033  *  in some 3-way, and 5-way roundabout.
00034  *
00035  *  Ex. enter rbt with exit count (1). exit rbt with exit count (3), the turn
00036  *      is ahead in roundabout.
00037  *  Ex  enter rbt with exit count (4). exit rbt with exit count (1), the turn
00038  *      is right in roundabout.
00039  *
00040  *  If the exit count is at entry or exit is (0) the normal rbExitnbr should
00041  *  be used --  Take the second exit in the roundabout.
00042  *
00043  *  Sometimes (5-way rbt) the entry could get a number but not the exit.
00044  *  Other values might be used, 11-14 might mean that only RIGHT_ROUNDABOUT
00045  *  should be allowed. 
00046  */
00047 
00048

00051 
00059 class CrossingConnectionElement : public VectorElement
00060 {
00061   public:
00068 
00069    virtual bool operator == (const VectorElement& elm) const {
00070       return ( (dynamic_cast<const CrossingConnectionElement*> (&elm) )
00071                         ->m_angle == m_angle );
00072    }
00073    
00075    virtual bool operator != (const VectorElement& elm) const {
00076       return ( (dynamic_cast<const CrossingConnectionElement*> (&elm) )
00077                ->m_angle != m_angle );
00078    }
00079    
00081    virtual bool operator > (const VectorElement& elm) const {
00082       return ( m_angle >
00083                (dynamic_cast<const CrossingConnectionElement*>
00084                 (&elm) )->m_angle);
00085    }
00086    
00088    virtual bool operator < (const VectorElement& elm) const {
00089             return ( m_angle <
00090                      (dynamic_cast<const CrossingConnectionElement*>
00091                       (&elm))->m_angle);
00092    }

00432    typedef vector<rbtconn_t> rbtconnvector_t;
00433    
00434    /*
00435     *  Recursive method to set crossing kind and exit count in roundabouts.
00436     *  Can make more recursive calls. After this method is done this crossing
00437     *  and the one created after this has crossing kind but not exitCount set.
00438     *  The conns vector is used by the caller to set exit counts.
00439     *  @param endNode The end node of this roundabout/figure. Indicates that a
00440     *                 full lap has been made.
00441     *  @param exits The number of exits found so far.
00442     *  @param calls The number of recursive calls. To abort endless loops
00443     *  @param conns The vector with entries and exits to hav their exitCounts
00444     *               set. Used to indicate symmetry.
00445     *  @return The final crossing kind for the whole figure (size of Rbt)
00446     */
00447    ItemTypes::crossingkind_t setRoundaboutCrossingKind(OldNode* endNode,
00448                                                        int &exits,
00449                                                        int calls,
00450                                                        uint32 nodeLength[4],
00451                                                        int32 &distance,
00452                                                        rbtconnvector_t &conns,
00453                                                        bool backward = false);
00454
